dcterms:creator: B. Recht
dcterms:description: The linear quadratic regulator problem (LQR) is often seen as the simplest non-trivial example for stochastic control and was proposed as an important test-bed in reinforcement learning. The LQR problem has a continuous state and action space, with the dynamics linear in the state and action, and the reward quadratic in the state and action.
dcterms:title: Linear Quadratic Regulator (LQR)

dcterms:creator: √Å. Cartea
S. Jaimungal
J. Penalva
dcterms:description: The environment models optimal execution in limit order books (LOB), where a trading agent aims to liquidate a position of assets in a fixed amount of time while maximizing trade revenues. The state consists of the current price of the asset and inventory, with a continuous action space.
dcterms:title: Optimal Execution in Limit Order Book Markets

dcterms:creator: V. Gupta
A. Radovanovic
dcterms:description: The stochastic online bin packing problem involves items of random size arriving over time that need to be allocated to bins of fixed size, aiming to minimize open capacities at each point in time. This problem is used to model various resource allocation problems.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Online Bin Packing

dcterms:creator: B. Balaji
J. Bell-Masterson
E. Bilgin
A. Damianou
P. M. Garcia
A. Jain
R. Luo
A. Maggiar
B. Narayanaswamy
C. Ye
dcterms:description: This dataset provides benchmarks for reinforcement learning in online stochastic optimization problems, facilitating the evaluation of various algorithms in this domain.
dcterms:title: Reinforcement Learning Benchmarks for Online Stochastic Optimization Problems
